item.description:
A French film you might be interested in:

Audrey Tautou is Nathalie, a beautiful, happy, and successful Parisian business executive who finds herself suddenly widowed after a three-year marriage to her soul mate. To cope with her loss, she buries herself and her emotions in her work to the dismay of her friends, family and co-workers. One day, inexplicably, her zest for life and love is rekindled by a most unlikely source, her seemingly unexceptional, gauche, and average looking office subordinate, Markus (comic star Francois Damiens). At first stunned by Nathalie's unexpected attention, Markus comes to gradually believe in her feelings and shifts into romantic high gear. As their relationship goes from awkward to genuinely loving, Nathalie and Markus will have to overcome a host of obstacles including everyone else's judgmental perceptions as well as their own self-doubts.

"Delicacy is a sweetheart of a love story, and cornball from stem to stern." -Roger Ebert, Chicago Sun-Times

"Delicacy is a small, bittersweet romance about getting over the loss of a loved one - if that's possible - and moving on." -Steven Rea, Philadelphia Inquirer

(France, 108 mins, French with English subtitles)

Fri. 5/18: 7 PM*
Sat. 5/19: 3 PM; 7 PM
Sun. 5/20: 3 PM; 7 PM
Mon. 5/21: 5 PM
Tues. 5/22: No Films
